meanings.definition: Having a high level of intelligence or cleverness.
meanings.sent1: She is the brannier student in the class, always acing her exams.
meanings.sent2: The detective's brannier mind helped him solve the case quickly.
meanings.sent3: The brannier squirrel outsmarted the other animals in the forest.
meanings.sent4: Her brannier ideas shone brightly in the brainstorming session.
meanings.sent5: His brannier approach to problem-solving impressed everyone.

meanings.definition: Comparative form of 'branny', meaning resembling or containing bran.
meanings.sent1: The bread had a brannier texture due to the added bran.
meanings.sent2: The cereal had a brannier taste with the extra bran flakes.
meanings.sent3: The brannier muffins were a hit at the breakfast party.
meanings.sent4: Her hair had a brannier look after using the new shampoo.
meanings.sent5: The soup had a brannier appearance with the bran sprinkled on top.

meanings.definition: Comparative form of 'bran', meaning the outer layer of a cereal grain.
meanings.sent1: The brannier of the wheat grain contains essential nutrients.
meanings.sent2: She prefers the brannier part of the rice for its fiber content.
meanings.sent3: The brannier of the oat grain adds a crunchy texture to the cereal.
meanings.sent4: The baker sifted out the brannier to make a smoother flour.
meanings.sent5: The brannier of the barley grain is often used in animal feed.
